section.title: API
section.para: The API component represents the primary interface into the compiler, namely, the Codfns.Fix function. It takes two arguments, which are specified by the following stimuli:

tr.td: A pathname that is somehow an invalid syntax or otherwise invalid to be used as a pathname
A filename that is syntactically valid and accessible/writable
A namespace script which obeys the structural requirements of the interface, which is also syntactically correct
A namespace script which obeys the structural requirements but which has syntactic errors or other compiler errors in it
A namespace script which does not obey the correct structural requirements of the Codfns.Fix function

section.para: The Codfns.Fix function may return the following responses, most of which are errors that indicate the exit of the system.

tr.td: Indicates a successful execution of the compiler and the return of a semantically equivalent namespace
Indicates that there was a structural error in the input
Indicates that the compiler produced a specific error, triggers a domain error together with an additional error indicating the type of error found in the compiler
Indicates that there was a problem with the filename or pathname given
